title: vulkan: Remove unused `backtrace` field from `Allocator`
body:
Only `SubAllocator`s print their backtrace and need to hold on to this field; there is no need for the `Allocator` to hold on to and own the exact same value.

Rust 1.57 now detects such unused fields, when they have previously only been used inside `derive()` macros such as `Debug`.

title: Upgrade to ash 0.34 with ash-window 0.8
body: This ash release switches over to a dynamically linked scheme where Vulkan is linked directly instead of through libloading by default.  As the main library crate doesn't need to load an entrypoint such linking is not desired at all and is disabled by default (as is runtime linking, effectively no entrypoints can be loaded): it must be re-enabled by hand when building the examples.

title: 🤷‍♂️ Adding an `Option<&mut bool>` argument in the allocator imgui rendering
body:
This allows calling code to do the following:

- Pass None to just render the editor as usual
- Pass Some(&mut bool) to control if the window is rendered and get information in return regarding a request for closure of the window (user clicks X button on the imgui window).
This allows for easier integration with UI systems.

I had conversations with @MarijnS95 about this and we're still not 100% happy with the code, adding the draft PR because I need to reference it in another project :P

title: ci: Include private items in the documentation build-test
body: Rust documentation is not only used to document the public API of a crate, but also as a convenience (ie. intellisense) to developers working on the crate-internals itself, some of which are not public.  Normally rustdoc would not build these docs but we'd still like to hold their contents to the same standards (ie. no broken links) as their public counterpart.

title: 🤷 cargo: Remove unused widestring and hassle-rs dependency
body: Didn't get to reviewing #79 midnight, and it got 🥷-merged in the morning 😬

title: Update widestring
LICENSE-APACHE is not a markdown file
body:
No other crates have it like this ✨

Fixes: 1c7a78f ("Add MIT and Apache 2.0 license texts (#76)")

title: cargo: Include license files in crate
body:
When explicitly specifying what files to include, cargo does not include license files [1] unless it was a custom license specified with `license-file`.

Fixes: 1c7a78f ("Add MIT and Apache 2.0 license texts (#76)")

[1]: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-exclude-and-include-fields

title: Add MIT and Apache 2.0 license texts
body: Fixes #75

title: Update description now that we support Dx12
body: Was left un-changed.

title: Update imgui to 0.8 and winit to 0.25
body: Same as #65 but with dependent PRs #28 and #29 merged in first, separately, for better bisectionability may something break along the way - and for easier patch-notes generation.

title: reduce size of Allocation structs
body:
This changes the name and backtraces fields on `Allocation` to be `Box<str>` instead of `String`, netting us a `mem::size_of::<Allocation>()` decrease from 104 to 88 bytes.

Same could be done on `AllocationError`, but would be an API break.

title: remove macos and ios limitation
body:
Hi there,

Since the 0.9.0 upgrade, the use of the library is broken at least on Apple M1. It seems that a Vulkan limitation was erroneously added to these platforms. I am running my project on this branch https://github.com/periferia-labs/rivi-loader/tree/ramp using changes of this fork, and all is good again.

To my understanding, the moltenvk support is already transparent. You can see from my project that moltenvk does not need to be added to Cargo.toml either for Vulkan to work.

I am happy to give more information about my current environment if you have disparities.

Another thing is that I cannot speak for iOS nor do I have x86 mac available this week. For M1 (target_arch = "aarch64") it works fine.

Thanks!

title: Implement Debug for d3d12 Allocator.
body: The `D3D12_HEAP_PROPERTIES` struct does not implement `Debug`, so we can't do a simple `[derive(Debug)]`. Since I don't really know what I am doing when it comes to implementing this manually, I just did what I found to be the simplest for debugging output. Feedback is welcome ^.^

title: Add function for renaming allocations.
body: Quick sketch up of renaming allocations as suggested in issue #66

title: Update imgui to 0.8 and winit to 0.25
body:
Depends on #28 and #29

#29 went down on winit version to accomodate `imgui-winit-support 0.7`'s usage of `winit 0.24`.

This also omits some id (label with `##`) assignments which are unnecessary when the item resides inside a stack with a unique item: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#q-how-can-i-have-multiple-widgets-with-the-same-label
These labels should only be used when:
- The label changes based on some dynamic variable like a counter while
  still representing the same object;
- Duplicate labels inside the same stack-item.

title: lib: Fix mismatched type mutability in documentation example
body:
---- src\lib.rs - (line 93) stdout ----
    error[E0308]: mismatched types
    Error:   --> src\lib.rs:103:27
       |
    12 |     device: Dx12DevicePtr(device as *const _),
       |                           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ types differ in mutability
       |
       = note: expected raw pointer `*mut c_void`
                  found raw pointer `*const _`

title: examples/d3d12-visualizer: Fix clippy::erasing_op by copying macro
body:
Commit 0d4aa76 ("Replace usage of helper function that is not available in latest released winapi. (#52)") imported the contents of a helper function (macro) that is not available in stable winapi, but leaves a clippy warning in place.  Instead, copy the original macro in place making it easier on the reader of this example to find and relate the all the math ops that are going on here, and fix the clippy warning at the same time.

This lint issue was found in: https://github.com/Traverse-Research/gpu-allocator/pull/56

title: Only render after `MainEventsCleared` event
body:
In the vulkan visualizer, events were not processed correctly.
Now it waits for the MainEventsCleared to break out of the loop.

title: Ensure allocation sizes do not exceed the heap size for vulkan validation.
body: Inside the vulkan allocator, no allocation attempts will be made when the requested memory size exceeds the size of the heap for that memory type. This prevents vulkan validation layer warnings.

title: ci: Enable `public-winapi` feature when compiling on Windows
body: Fixes #55

title: Disabling buffer_device_address in vulkan examples
body:
The vulkan examples are not doing the usual checking and enabling of features, so the feature should be disabled by default.
We could do the feature checking and enabling of the feature accordingly, but I didn't want to unnecessarily complicate the example.

Thoughts?

title: Fix bug in d3d12-visualization example that CI didn't catch.
body: The `D3D12_DEFAULT_SHADER_4_COMPONENT_MAPPING` helper function is not defined in the latest `winapi` release. Replace it with inline bitwise logic.

title: Change winapi dependency from git to the latest released version
body: Winapi was set to a custom branch that adds some `d3d12` bindings for ray tracing. The `d3d12` version of `gpu-allocator` does not use any of those features, so we can simply use the latest version published on crates.io.

title: vulkan/visualizer: Use Ash built-in bitflags string formatting
body:
(Originally PR'd in #38, lost during the refactor)

Ash already defines a stringifyer for bitflags (see `const_debugs.rs`) that is autogenerated based on all available flags, not just what happened to be available at the time this visualizer was written.

title: Fix broken intradoc links and test rustdoc in CI
body: Let us make sure our public crates have sane docs over at https://docs.rs/gpu-allocator/ :)

title: Remove winapi from public interface.
body:
In our own projects we are running on a different branch of winapi. This causes all types to be incompatible. Additionally, it would be nice to have the option to use `windows-rs`.
In order to achieve these goals we want to remove `winapi` from the public facing API. Luckily this comes down to having two abstract pointer types around and a helper that is now behind a feature flag.

title: Use `im_str!` macro for easier ImGui (formatted) string creation
Replace log! with debug!/warn! macros
visualization: Replace custom event conversion with imgui-winit-support
body: Depends on ~~#27 and~~ #28

title: visualization: Remove channel and only render on MainEventsCleared
body:
~~Depends on #27~~

With the loop and channel we were previously redrawing and rendering a frame _for every event_.  With vsync enabled this immediately locks up the application as mouse polling rates are well above that.

We cleaned our own applications to embrace winit's "new" eventloop closure instead of dealing with all the desync, race conditions and other oddities when using a separate thread to handle the events, and do the same here too.

---

Still draft, need to check why we're freeing buffers that are still in active command buffers, and why the application is extremely slow to drag around.
